thread.title: UK appoints 1st female Scotland Yard chief in 188 years
thread.title_full: UK appoints 1st female Scotland Yard chief in 188 years

title: UK appoints 1st female Scotland Yard chief in 188 years
text: UK appoints 1st female Scotland Yard chief in 188 years   LONDON  Feb 22, 2017, 9:57 AM ET 0 Shares The British government says senior officer Cressida Dick will be the next commissioner of London's Metropolitan Police — the first woman to lead Scotland Yard in its 188-year history. Dick, a former assistant commissioner of the force, succeeds Bernard Hogan-Howe, who is stepping down next week. The Home Office announced the appointment of 56-year-old Dick on Wednesday. Dick is highly regarded by many Scotland Yard peers, but she has drawn criticism for commanding an operation in the wake of the July 2005 London bombings in which an innocent Brazilian man, Jean Charles de Menezes, was shot dead by police after being mistaken for a suicide bomber . A jury cleared Dick of blame, but relatives of de Menezes' had called for her not to be given the top job. 0 Shares
